articles.headline: Prosecutors Tell Trump’s Legal Team He Is a Target of Investigation
articles.snippet: The notice from the office of the special counsel Jack Smith suggested that an indictment was on the horizon in the investigation into the former president’s handling of classified documents.
articles.abstract: The notice from the office of the special counsel Jack Smith suggested that an indictment was on the horizon in the investigation into the former president’s handling of classified documents.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors have informed the legal team for former President Donald J. Trump that he is a target of their investigation into his handling of classified documents after he left office, according to two people familiar with the matter.
articles.byline: By Alan Feuer, Maggie Haberman, William K. Rashbaum and Glenn Thrush

articles.headline: Universal Says On-Demand Film Strategy Has Increased Audience
articles.snippet: The studio let viewers rent or buy movies earlier for a higher price. This made more than $1 billion in less than three years, with nearly no decrease in box-office sales.
articles.abstract: The studio let viewers rent or buy movies earlier for a higher price. This made more than $1 billion in less than three years, with nearly no decrease in box-office sales.
articles.lead_paragraph: In 2020, at the height of the pandemic, Universal Pictures and its art-house sibling, Focus Features, set off alarm bells in Hollywood by ending the long-held practice of giving theaters an exclusive window of about 90 days to play new movies. Instead, their movies, which have since included “Jurassic World: Dominion,” “Belfast,” “Cocaine Bear” and “M3gan,” would become available for digital rental or purchase — at a higher price — after as little as 17 days.

articles.headline: Timeline: CNN’s 18 Months of Tumult
articles.snippet: The cable news network has struggled to weather a series of controversies, which culminated this week in the sudden departure of its chairman, Chris Licht, after a chaotic run at the top.
articles.abstract: The cable news network has struggled to weather a series of controversies, which culminated this week in the sudden departure of its chairman, Chris Licht, after a chaotic run at the top.
articles.lead_paragraph: CNN has endured nearly two years of turmoil as the cable news network has struggled to overcome national scandals, abrupt departures, plummeting ratings and declining profits.

articles.headline: Disaster Upon Disaster: Flood Deepens Misery in Ukraine War Zone
articles.snippet: “We were getting used to the shelling, but I’ve never seen a situation like this,” said one woman rescued in Kherson after a dam upstream was destroyed.
articles.abstract: “We were getting used to the shelling, but I’ve never seen a situation like this,” said one woman rescued in Kherson after a dam upstream was destroyed.
articles.lead_paragraph: Oleksiy Kolesnik waded ashore and stood, trembling, on dry land for the first time in hours, rescued on Wednesday morning after spending the predawn sitting on top of a cabinet in his flooded living room.
articles.byline: By Andrew E. Kramer, Maria Varenikova and Mauricio Lima

articles.headline: With Migrant Flights, DeSantis Shows Stoking Outrage Is the Point
articles.snippet: The flights to California illustrate the broader bet Gov. Ron DeSantis has made that the animating energy in the G.O.P. has shifted from conservatism to confrontationalism.
articles.abstract: The flights to California illustrate the broader bet Gov. Ron DeSantis has made that the animating energy in the G.O.P. has shifted from conservatism to confrontationalism.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ron DeSantis’s decision to send migrants from near the Mexico border to the capital city of California is at first glance the latest in a series of escalating clashes between the Florida governor and his Democratic counterpart, Gavin Newsom.

articles.headline: Liberal Prosecutors Are Revisiting Police Killings but Charging Few Officers So Far
articles.snippet: Pamela Price, a new district attorney in Northern California, is the latest to reopen cases that had seemingly been shut, including one from more than 15 years ago.
articles.abstract: Pamela Price, a new district attorney in Northern California, is the latest to reopen cases that had seemingly been shut, including one from more than 15 years ago.
articles.lead_paragraph: Agustin Gonsalez was shot dead in 2018 by officers in Hayward, Calif., when the police said he refused to drop a sharp object during a confrontation on a dark street.
articles.byline: By Eliza Fawcett and Tim Arango

articles.headline: Does CNN’s Turmoil Mean There’s No Room on Cable for Independent News?
articles.snippet: Chris Licht’s tenure illuminated how increasingly hard it can be to find success on the divided cable news dial.
articles.abstract: Chris Licht’s tenure illuminated how increasingly hard it can be to find success on the divided cable news dial.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Warner Bros. Discovery chief, David Zaslav, was clear from the day he took control of CNN in 2022 about what he wanted for the cable news network. Publicly and privately he told associates, reporters and whoever else might care that he wanted to move the network away from what he viewed as left-leaning “advocacy” and toward more “balance.” His CNN would not be anti-Trump, and would be more welcoming for Republicans.

articles.headline: Hey, Alexa, What Should Students Learn About A.I.?
articles.snippet: While schools debate what to teach students about powerful new A.I. tools, tech giants, universities and nonprofits are intervening with free lessons.
articles.abstract: While schools debate what to teach students about powerful new A.I. tools, tech giants, universities and nonprofits are intervening with free lessons.
articles.lead_paragraph: Rohit Prasad, a senior Amazon executive, had an urgent message for ninth and 10th graders at Dearborn STEM Academy, a public school in Boston’s Roxbury neighborhood.

articles.headline: New A.I. Chatbot Tutors Could Upend Student Learning
articles.snippet: Proponents see the tools as a way to automatically customize academic support. They could also make children test subjects for A.I. experiments.
articles.abstract: Proponents see the tools as a way to automatically customize academic support. They could also make children test subjects for A.I. experiments.
articles.lead_paragraph: A dozen students huddled at communal classroom tables one morning this spring, their gazes fixed on math lessons on their laptops.

articles.headline: Pat Robertson, Who Gave Christian Conservatives Clout, Is Dead at 93
articles.snippet: A Baptist minister and a broadcaster, he turned evangelicals into a powerful constituency that helped Republicans capture Congress in 1994. He earlier ran for president.
articles.abstract: A Baptist minister and a broadcaster, he turned evangelicals into a powerful constituency that helped Republicans capture Congress in 1994. He earlier ran for president.
articles.lead_paragraph: Pat Robertson, a Baptist minister with a passion for politics who marshaled Christian conservatives into a powerful constituency that helped Republicans capture both houses of Congress in 1994, died on Thursday at his home in Virginia Beach, Va. He was 93.

articles.headline: What Recession? Economy’s Staying Power Poses Big Questions for the Fed.
articles.snippet: The Federal Reserve has been trying to slow growth without tanking it. Now, officials must ask if inflation can cool amid signs of resilience.
articles.abstract: The Federal Reserve has been trying to slow growth without tanking it. Now, officials must ask if inflation can cool amid signs of resilience.
articles.lead_paragraph: Employers are hiring rapidly. Home prices are rising nationally after months of decline. Consumer spending climbed more than expected in a recent data release.

articles.headline: Supreme Court Rejects Voting Map That Diluted Black Voters’ Power
articles.snippet: Voting rights advocates had feared that the decision about redistricting in Alabama would further undermine the Voting Rights Act, which instead appeared to emerge unscathed.
articles.abstract: Voting rights advocates had feared that the decision about redistricting in Alabama would further undermine the Voting Rights Act, which instead appeared to emerge unscathed.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court, in a surprise decision, ruled on Thursday that Alabama had diluted the power of Black voters in drawing a congressional voting map, reaffirming a landmark civil rights law that had been thought to be in peril.
